name: Serena
description: How long has it been? A man sits in a distant getaway cabin waiting for his wife Serena. Where is she? Things in the cabin evoke memories, and the husband comes to a disturbing realization... This short point-and-click adventure is the result of a massive collaborative effort between dozens of fans and designers of adventure games.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows® XP Processor: 1.6Ghz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: OpenGL 2.0 compatible with 128MB Storage: 500 MB available space

reviews.review_text: A must-have for the lovers of storytelling.   Think of Serena as an interactive story: you need to click on things to collect info and, piece after piece, you'll begin to understand what's going on. If you enjoy reading and investigating, just download it. Otherwise, don't.  For the ones interested, this is what is going to happen: Serena will take about one hour of your time and you'll  probably  leave the finished game thinking: 'Well? Is this all? It's so obvious that things went THAT way...'  Then, you'll go back to your life.  Later on, you will remember one small detail and think: 'But if things went THAT way, how should I explain... this?' Another detail will haunt you. And another one will follow.   At this point, you'll realize there was much more depth in this  free  yet precious gem than what you first assumed, so you'll feel compelled to start all over and try to make ALL the pieces fit together.  At least, this is exactly what happened to me.  Serena is a wonderful gift to the community and I really recommend downloading it.
A short, quite good drama, even if the ending is not clear.  On a side note: don't hit 'Esc' if you are not done with the game, because there's no saving feature.

You walk around in a wooden cabin, examining stuff, unfolding the story, which gets creepier and creepier. It's pretty interesting how the mood (the comments of the character and the appearance of the cabin) changes during the course of the game and gets, like I said, darker.   Good story, originally made up (mindf...) ending with a very nice surprise to it -- sure was an hour well spent.

Serena may be a short game, but the tale woven throughout the hour-long experience will last a lifetime. The deep, multilayered narrative keeps changing and makes you wondering what will happen next. Even by the time the credits roll you're not quite sure exactly what happened.  It is a game built by fans and developers of adventure games FOR fans and developers of adventure games...a gift for the community that proves that 'true friends stand by each other through any adversity'.

Serena a free Steam game will take an hour or so too to fully unlock all its contents .So many questions and thoughts will come to mind as you explore the tiny cabin with many secrets to tell. Give it a try and be prepaired to be thrown for a roller coaster of a ride in short story.

Serena is a short and atmospheric exploration game that plays like a simplistic point and click game without the usual gameplay elements such as inventories, puzzles or different locations and is set in a cabin in the woods, where you play as a man who seemingly lost his memory and now is trying to find clues about the whereabouts of his wife, Serena.  While the gameplay itself isn't anything special, it's the story that keeps the game going. It starts out as sort of a love story of a young couple but the further you progress and the more memories you regain, the clearer your mind gets and faces you with the sad truth of what your relationship with your beloved wife has become.  I don't want to spoil anything of the story, but it's an intense emotional rollercoaster ride throughout the ~1 hour of playtime and if you're looking for a relaxing game that tells both a sweet and sad story, make sure to check the game out.  It's free!

excellent look at mental illness and failed relationships. similar in style to 'gone home' but more in the horror genre. Short game and it is free. totally worth the time if you enjoy games that make you think later.

Even though I generally like point-and-clicks, I found the style of this game to be tedious and the voice acting subpar. If you can look past these things, it could be worth playing. The atmosphere is a plus.

For the price point I can strongly suggest you waste an hour of your life playing this. That being said, it is full of artistic flaw as much as its strong points.   Pros: Great ambience and music. Wonderful design of the cabin to fit the *I'm assuming* desired feel. The female voice actor did her job well. The animations while few were well designed for the story. And oh god the plot twist...  Cons: The damn main voice actor reads his lines as if being teleprompted at 6am with not a damn in the world. Probably cuz he did it for free. He just didn't fit with the rest of the projects paticularly somber mood. His highlights were when he was angry and even that was bordering on dull. Aside from that, the repeating of dialouge after exhausting memories was a bit annoying, the cursor was bordering on non-intuitive, and...   Like I said, for free its worth the 1 hour acknowledgement of a decent piece of digital artwork. If they asked for money, I'd say pass it up. It tried hard, it really did; but it missed its mark somewhere and I'm guessing its because of its main actor and frustrating mouse interface.

10/10, it's a very interesting history, in fact even if the game just lasts lest than 30minutes, it was interesant finding out who the heck he was, and well the end was kinda.. obvius but still nice game!
Its very creepy and interesting game. I think it's worthy game. I recomend it for people who like the story of person with unexpected turn of events.

Serena is a short free point and click game ( you can't really call it a game because there is no real game-play/puzzles )  you just click on things to learn the story. i won't say anything about the story here but i can tell that you will find love, hate, hope, wonder, suspicion & regret and many other feelings. the end is sad & shocking, personally i was expecting something completely different. the graphics are good also, with nice music & voice acting. it's such an amazing & interesting experiment, even if it's short (it took me 1 hour to complete it) but you will spend a lot of time to understand it & you won't forget it easily . so considering that it's free, everyone should give it a try i hope there will be more games like this, definitely recommended ! 8-7/10

Amazing. Creepy ending but I will say nothing.  Graphics 8-9/10 Gameplay 5-6/10 Storyline 10/10 Climax 7-8/10  Would reccomant for fans of Windows 8 game Adera and also fans of Mystery and playing games for the storyline.  Should there be a Serena 2?

The game doesn't save, so you'd have to play it through in one go, which I find difficult because it's terribly boring. The story doesn't really excite me, and the protagonist is unstable and moody like a 6 year old. It's a game about clicking the same objects over and over again, hoping for new dialog. Don't play it, just get Dear Esther if you are interested in that kind of game.

What an amazing character! I love how the character is built and how the room is giving me the creeps as i walk around! Sweet game. PS: If you have depression or anxiety like me you might wanna play with breaks.

nice 'experience'. I would call it interactive monologue ;). In general this is point-and-click adventure game but all you do is listening to descriptions of objects you find, discovering story along the way. Story is simple narrative with moral and spooky mood, i enjoyed it, give it a try.  IMPORTANT: game offers no save system and takes about 30mins to complete. ESC key closes the game.

Short flash of foreign life. Timeless period of weird memories. Silent madness of past, present and future.  Simple point-and-click game, that will tell you a lifelong story.  And even when everything seems to be good, you should never forget: everybody have a skeleton in their closet.

A fantastic little short story. Featuring the voice talents of Sarah 'Pushing Up Roses' Wilson, this is a story that really keeps you wondering until 'that point'. Not so much an adventure game in the pure sense, as there is no inventory as such, but once you get the hang of the controls, you won't have too much trouble. A few issues wondering what to do next, but if you follow a certain pattern, you'll get through it fairly quickly.  Overall, give this game a shot. After all, it's free and there is obviously a lot of love and care put into the game. I give it 4 out of 5 stars.

I can not tell you how much I recommend this game, in only a few minutes I felt so drawn to the story. I haven't experienced that with any other game in the last few years.  But beware, this is not a game about funny deaths or clever puzzles If you cannot take the time, if you do not have the patients to listen to the character, then this is not a game for you!
Amazing, be patient and explore the cabin, remembering to go back to things you have already checked, really interesting and creepy story and the narration was brilliant, definitely worth a try.
Idk what to say .. but try it .. it's good story
'Serena' is a short game with good graphics and interesting story and in addition free. So why not try to play it?

I really enjoyed this game! I've paid for games that were not nearly as good as this! I felt the storyline was nice. It's a dark game, but it's supposed to be of course. It's point and click, so no free roaming around, but I don't think it takes away from the atmosphere of it, and the voice naration is really good. Which adds to the story a lot. To get the atmosphere they did with point and click, music adn voice acting was really imporessive. It's not an extremely long game, but I reallly think people who are fans of mystery, what I am going to call horror light, and point and click are really going to like this game. I definately recommend it!

Serena was an odd little game. The emotional turmoil felt by the protagonist made me better appreciate the blessings that I have in my life at the moment. It was a short trip into a somewhat disturbing world of melancholy, loss, and woe, which took me about an hour to complete. It was an interesting experiment, or whatever you want to call it, of a game and I enjoyed the twists as the protagonists recalls and discovers new pieces of information as his thoughts explore the items and memories found within the cabin.
Simple, short point and click adventure with good writing and voice acting. Worth the hour it takes to play it.

Beautiful graphics for a free game and I had a rude awakening at the climax of the story. If you don't enjoy point clicker games, this isn't for you. Soley story based. I enjoyed it though especially for the plot.
I went in with no expectations and came out pleasantly surprised. This is a great little game.

What can I say about Serena? There is no monsters. Nothing jumping out of you. Just a small cabin with a story locked inside. The game seems simple enough; a game about loss and being lonely after finding the one you love. But, as the game goes on and the story goes on, you will find yourself questioning everything, even after the story ends. The story is depressing yet wonderfully written. Hopefully, you'll give Serena a chance and experience the horror and mystery for yourself.

Added: PUSHINGUPROSES!! I did not know that PUR was Serena in this game. I mean, I wasn't subbed to her until after I played this, but as I'm replaying this right now, I can hear all of her and it's making me fangirl. She is amazing.  I had a great time crying and being scared all at once.  The fact that it had a horror feeling but only told a deep and dark story. It was almost as if I was playing An Then There Were None or Sherlock Holmes vs Jack the Ripper. I loved every second of this game. I really wish there were more games like this; eeire feeling with litte to no jump scares. I do hope YouTube gamers do Let's Plays of this.

Pretty interesting! A bit eerie, but nice.  Pros: *Really cool story *Makes you think *A bit scary in a not scary way  Cons: *You can't move freely. At all. *You cannot save your game.  Was close to do a bad review, but the story convinced me.

A really sad,atmospheric,with dark twisted features,game that will make your spine chill and your heart break.Senscape developers should really consider a part 2 focusing on Serena's side.It really makes me wonder what actually drove her into actually cheating her husband and plotting alongside the other guy in order to kill him(her husband) other than dullness.I really think the community would support that kind of game.Even a series of games maybe. Again thank you Senscape devs,really appreciated :)
Deeply moving. Short and minimalistic action-wise, but emotionally replete and not for the faint of heart! A freebie gem!
A short but enjoyably disturbing game. At first the voice acting was distracting but it quickly added more to the atmosphere than it took away.
Wow. Definitely dark. Almost everything seems calculated to make the mood right. It's not happy happy fun time, so don't complain that's 'itz 2 depressn waa!'
Are you kidding me ? That's it ! I mean is there any episodes or parts of this game ?! ... Please continue the story ... Do anything ... We must know what happend to them ... Such a wonderful game.
If you're into atmospheric games, this should really work for you. No jump scares, if anyone is curious. Just an intensely unsettling environment that makes your imagination run wild.

Very nice story driven little game. Creates a lot of atmosphere and, for a short tale, it's packed with a few plot twists. Also open to several interpretations, a bit like a David Lynch movie, or one of the first Silent Hill games.

You know what? It's free so I'm suggesting it, and it is a short game so it wont take too much of your time. Pretty creepy overall feel to the game which keeps it interesting but it also had many aspects I didn't like. I'd give it a 6/10

Gave me the feels at first and I saw it coming, but just not like that. This game leaves you thinking.. it's nice if you like short story games with a rich plot, it's nice and small too, doesn't really give you much room to work in since it's mainly focused on the dialogue. But aye, it's free.

Very Interesting story. Nice gameplay , it is interesting even for non-adventure players. Unfortunatly it doesn't have a long gameplay. But the story and the environment is very fulfilling and thrilling.
A dark interactive short story. It's a little rough around the edges, but... oh well, all of their kind are. Will surely be of interest to IF enthusiasts.

i love hp love craft so i thought i would check this out at first i admit i was thinking wth do i do and wth is going on but i caught on what to do and i must say it was a good little game, cant complain for free, and it was half way through i got what had happend and and then understood it why he was like that,loved the pic on the table wont say anything as dont want to spoil it see for yourself, if got some spare time try and see it was agood game, i cant wait for more of his games to be on here it does get your brain going you have to go over things a lot but the story is a good one over all i would buy this game
Jesus christ how horrifying
If you enjoy clicking on tons of ♥♥♥♥ then this is your game

Serena, for me, was less of a game and more of an experience. The build up to finding out what happened to Serena felt perfectly paced, through all of the twists that were unfolded by the player. This truly add to the emersion of the game and I feel like it couldn't be better. Even after you find out what happened, it's paced rather well.  However, while the build up to the ending was impecable, the ending, to me, felt rather rushed and just felt kind of sloppy in general. The ending has no real explanation behind it as two semingly, new characters are introduced and have very little impact on the story other than to tie up the game and force it to end.  While I, personally, didn't like the ending; I'd definitely recomment it to anyone. This game is a work of art and should not be overlooked.
This game was truly an experience, I thoroughly enjoyed every moment, there are so many twists and turns in what you think is happening without truly knowing. I definitely recommend it.

Being an animation student who has experienced creating a game, this makes me realize how story is the important factor to anything you'd want to play through, laidback or not. Mayn, what a plot twist. This should at least cost a dollar. :D

I found this game purely coincidence.. After playing it, my first expression was 'It was beautiful!' For 15 minutes gameplay or so, this game offer a great graphic, great atmosphere, great voice actor and of course, a great story. This game really capture the emotion of a man who constantly in a doubt. The emotion of care, love, hate dan then despair, this game deliver it successfully. The dark, gritty cabin atmosphere make even the story goes deeper and deeper.  Play this game and step into a mind of a man who doesn't even know who he is, what he is, and the truth that lies within his cabin.
This game... that ending...
If you enjoy clicking on tons of ♥♥♥♥ then this is your game

Serena is one of those games that everyone should experience. The story is a disturbing ride with many ups and downs that ultimately ends in a way that I never saw coming. Although short, Serena had enough content to make me feel a bit sad, scared, very angry, confused and shocked, but at no point did I ever feel bored.   I finished the game in less than an hour and really enjoyed my time with it. I won't go into any details about the story, but I will say that this is one game that will stick with you for a while and the fact that it is free, completely different from anything else that I've played and kept my interest for the entirety of its short length, makes it a game I fully recommend. A 10 out of 10!
I liked this & it was creepy with a surprise ending! It was a little too short... compared to other point & clicks but still worth playing.

I played this game one day when my internet cut out. It was pretty great, although it only took 10-15 minutes to complete. The story is interesting, but I got stuck once because I wasn't clicking on the right things. If you do get stuck, just click on everything in the house until new dialogue is available. This is a point and click story game. It's very simple, but enjoyable if you don't have anything better to do.  (Unfortunately I played this game in offline mode, so I had to leave it open while afk so I could write a review. My in-game hours are not accurate for this game.)  Also some of the dialogue is entertaining if you go afk for a minute or two.

At first I found everything the main character was saying as a little long and winded but that was before I realised what was going on. Then I started to love it. The plot twist was GREAT brilliant writing and I loved the voice acting. One thing I would have liked though was a main menu and a the ability to pause. I will definitely be waiting for similar games, I adore point and click and this was done really well. The ability to right click and change the browsing speed was really helpful.   SPOILER COMING UP  I would have liked to have the ability to discover more right before the fire, like multiple endings where you draw differenct conclusions about the body. Would have made it that much greater  Thanks for an interesting game that kept me from my homework

At a certain point I was really sympathising with her...even feeling sorry for what I thought his mental illness... It was a shock when I finally understood the truth. Poor soul. This game is a little gem, I want to say THANK YOU to the developers for it. I enjoyed the photo's trick, it's a classic, Dorian Grey's style. I sincerely hope that they'll do something else, because this is talent.
This game creeped me out. The feeling started out subtle and it grew as the story unfolded. If you like disturbing, it's interesting and doesn't take long to play.

Ah, the influence of adventure games past hangs heavy on this work...very enjoyable. I love seeing the Infocom references everywhere (especially the rug and what may lay below!). This is an enjoyable if tragic story to play, and it is done like the more recent Zork-style games (quicktime VR). A fun little short-story...please do more. Thanks for makimg it free to play.
intelligent and dark game for a thinking audience  really well done and well worth a try
Really interesting listening to a man talking about his wife and how his memories developes. 8/10

Pretty decent considering it's free. It's an atmospheric and eerie, point-and-click, one-shot horror game worth spending an hour to an hour and a half on. Good emotional engagement considering its brevity. Strong ending.
This game... that ending...
One of the rare instances of psychological horror done rather well. No cheap jump scares; this title is plenty haunting without them.
Good game, I really enjoyed it. It's a short playthrough, expect around 60 minutes to finish it. And it's free, so what are you waiting for?

Start: ugh, I already know what the 'twist' ending is going to be *hair flick*  Mid-way through: lol, totally saw that bit coming ....but wait....  Ending: ..........oh. my god. *sits slack-jawed for half an hour*  This game (narrative is probably a better word) is incredible. Simple, but haunting. If you're after actiony adventure games, pick something else.. but if you're after something that will make you think and feel, you should definitely get this. It's powerful and eerie. The music, the words, the setting - all excellent.   NB: if you don't agree with this, that's cool... but this game definitely appealed to me. 10/10 would feels again.
What the actual ♥♥♥♥ did i just witness.  10/10 would listen to story about a salt shaker again
can be boring if your not use to story based click-adventure, if your use to them very intresting and fun with a unexpected ending

The only real thought this game left me with, was 'Well, that was short.' It really would have been nicer to learn more about both the characters, I wanted to know what happened. I play most games for story, so this one really let me wishing for more. It only took me about half an hour to complete, and like I said, there is potenial for so much more. So yes, I did like this game, but it mad me angry how fast it ended.
Literal ghoststory so spooky , fotos on the wall of kids is creepy too , cool game:)
10 out of 10
Fun game to keep you on edge of your seat. Too short!!

A fairly well-crafted point and click that's definitely worth an hour of your time. There are a few techincal issues, but the story is just ambiguous enough to leave you thinking while remaining viscerally satisfying.
Fun game to keep you on edge of your seat. Too short!!
Twisty and interesting... and free. Not much of a downside.

I can't recommend nor to disrecomend this one. I hope someday steam will add 'Abstain' option in their review section.  It's a very short free game with simple point and click elements. It doesn't have any puzzle to solve or multiple path to choose. All you have to do is just follow the story. Speaking of the story, well, it's somehow cliché and too few to mention without digging up any spoiler. But the plot is delivered in quite good way, if you like this classic type of point and click game, for only 1 hour gameplay.  One thing that feel really bad in this game is.... There is no start menu! You can't really 'start' a game without clicking any start button, can you? :P *kidding* (You probably could change some of the game's settings through editing a lua script. But there is no point on doing that. This is a very light game as it is.).

This was a fairly incredible, although short, game. It's fully exploration-based and takes the player on an emotional 360 through the narrator's past with his absent wife. The ambiance of the cabin changes as the memories unfold, along with the tone of the background music. It really paints the emotions into your mind as you play, setting you up for some pretty interesting plot-twists as you go.  Highly recommended, as it only takes a short time to play and is free. You get a decent lot for your time. I personally was a little traumatized by the ending, but I feel it's a mark of a good game when it can leave you saying 'wow...' for a little while after you're done.

this game is a very fun little point and click you can tell it took some time a dedication to put this little vignette. has its dark omonious tone that gradually slips it way in not feeling forced and as a whole i enjoyed the game for the hour it took to complete. worth playing. and it has Pushing Up Roses in it so thats a plus.
This game is soo good i can't even explain it it also free!

Late night talking to friends over mic when this pops up free of charge. Download in a few mins and start it up, curiosity getting the better of me. Suddenly I'm commited to finding out the story, it gripped me in the first couple if mins into it. I'm not usually one for games about heart brake and sadness but for reason this game had me going late into the night looking for clues to his life, listening to all he had to say about what happened while I discuss the possibilities with my friend. Despite having not played the game to the end (got to sleep at some point) I really liked the story to the point I got to, with both sadness and horror this game really does make you think. However it would of be nice to have a bit more iteraction and actual controlled movement instead of click to where you want to be. All in all the makers of this game aced gripping story and great image quality. It's free, play it, you won't be disappionted.
I thought I knew where the story was going, but I was dead wrong. Then the game proceeded to hit me right in the feels.

When first starting the game I thought it would be just some lame point and click horror game with a few jumpscares here and there but at the end (Not going to spoil it) its worth it. Gameplay is mostly just clicking on objects that may be important in uncovering the story of a man and his wife and waht happened between them. The game is quite short, it took me around 23 mins but because it is free and doesn't use much space it's worth a quick look.

For a short F2P Point-and-Clikc, this is beautiful.  The Good- Beautiful, heart-wrenching story Ending with all them FEEEELS Impressive graphics Powerful soundtrack to compliment the FEEEEELS  The Bad- Rather short Story is a bit convoluted, as well as slightly ambiguous Not very replayable Not much to do, nor are there multiple ways of completing  The Ugly- Can't quite remember Serena enough

I saw one plot twist, but the next one definitely caught me off guard! I would love to see another title like this.  - Katfysh  Serena is a reminiscent point-and-click adventure game about a man who's trying to figure out why his wife, Serena, is gone. He looks around the cabin they shared together and tries to remember all the times they shared. However, he can't seem to remember her face...  Estimated play time: 1-2 hours   PS: My play time didn't record on my first playthrough. Weird.
Short but very rich in story. 9/10
Good game, good graphics and runs great....Played it on my old account which is why it shows only 0.2 hrs played!

This game is just as short as it gets, but since it's free I guess you can't complain. The issue is that you learn about the characters more and more and that's good, but the game kinda stops and becomes extremely boring very-very quickly if you can't find the thing to interact with to advance. If you happen to find everything asap I think finishing the game may take less than 5 minutes. Also I have no idea what the ♥♥♥♥ was that ending, they could've went any cheap cliché and I probably wouldn't have minded it, but this was probably the dumbest way to end it.  Also, the voice acting is surprisingly very good, didn't expect that from a free title.  I think it's worth a try, because it's definietly not bad. You have nothing to lose other than 10 minutes of your life if you don't like it.
Very good short story. Nice voice acting as well as nice twist at the end.
Great little weird story,with happy end !  7/10  Ratings (0-3 Don't bother @ all) (4-7 The Average) (8-10 One of the best)
This game was well designed, yet poorly put together. Didn't have a good way of putting the story together, how can you expect everyone to click everything a second time, or even a third time.

A very interesting yet eerie little game. I enjoyed the story and learning about the relationship between the man and serena as you inspect the items throughout the cabin. I would deffinitley recommend this game.

A short but spellbinding interactive story. The beauty of this game relies mainly on its ability to go from a semmingly peaceful situation to an horrific one with such a slow gradient that you find yourself feeling fear without even knowing why. A masterfully directed story that I suggest to anyone in need for a few chills.

When i looked at this game, i didn't expect a story like this. the story was very good with some diologue that gave me feeling. the game made me feel the character and what he was going through. and the ending to the game was surprising enough for me to not expect it. i'll give this a 9/10, it would have been better if it was longer, but still, pretty good short indie game with a interesting story
i dont usually play point and click games but this one is just amazing and since its free u should give it a shot

Very dark and disturbing story. Voice acting is great and really brings you into the game, making you want to know more. Music is haunting and genuinely quite scary at points.  Simple point and click style game. No options or menu, and no save. (So try not to hit Esc by accident, or you'll have to start again).  It's free, and isn't very long. Well worth giving it a go.
It's the first point & click adventure game I played and I quite enjoyed it.
Very impressive game. Looks and sounds fantastic and I enjoyed the story a lot.  Short and sweet.  (Don't press Escape during gameplay though...)
Very good. Not too long and will keep you guessing until the end. Definitely worth a playthrough!
mind♥♥♥♥! Try it :)

The plot was good, the gameplay was okay. Though it took me a while to figure out what I had to click in order for the story to go on/progress further and be consistent (I'm not sure if that was my own problem or).  Reason why I don't really recommend this game was since you probably already questioned yourself 'Where is Serena?' or 'What happened?' you'll probably already get ideas on what you think happened and you may be right. {Personal Feeling: And since I'm a fan of mysterious adventure games, I already expected what happened... to happen.} Though your gut feeling wouldn't really answer your questions on their own.   I also think there are some questions unanswered in the story itself and that its story is really short and slow. But if you have enough patience, I think it would be fine.  Overall- I like it, but... can't say I actually enjoyed it. So, no. I don't recommend it.  *Try playing it and see how you feel about it, we all feel different about things. :3
Great writing, acting, art, music, engine, plot, and especially great ending. Exactly the right length. Unforgettable ending. It's like a campfire ghost story.  What a labour of love.

I paid for nothing, therefore I expected nothing. So despite the fact that the gameplay was severely limited, the story wasn't awful. Without spoiling it for you, there was a twist in the plot which I wasn't expecting. Having said that, I certainly wouldn't pay money for this game. It was an experience. Whether it was good or bad is difficult to say. If it's still free, try it out for yourself.
I loved it. Short and interesting story, this game fulfilled what it promised. It would be nice to see more games like this.

Serena places you in an old cabin in control of a man that is lost and confused. The main question being: 'Where is Serena?' Throughout this short exploration game that question is answered in a twist of emotions and memories that will have you empathising with the character. I would recommend this game to absolutely anybody that enjoys exploration/adventure games or those that desire a wonderful story that may leave you with a shiver down your spine. EDIT: Hah, I didn't realize people actually read these. My bad. I only had the very first sentence in this review before, but I'm going to flesh it out now.  Meh. I found it extremely predictable personally.  There isn't much 'game' to this game. You just click and hear a little voice over, which honestly is fine if done well and cleverly. But this had a fairly predictable story and it was more like 'I know what's going on so hurry up, I know this is going to happen, so happen already!'  There's nothing wrong IMO with interactive storytelling, but if you compare this to say, Gone Home, the quality in story telling is just so different. In Gone Home, you explore a house and find stuff and eventually piece together a story. In Serena, you're in a one room cabin, and you have you click on things in a certain order to get the story.   For example, you might want to open something and it'll say 'No, I don't want to open it yet! I just don't feel like it. Maybe later.' That just feels so contrived, especially when you know something important is inside. So then you walk around the room clicking on things over and over many times the same thing. Then go back and see if you feel like opening the various things now. No? 'I'll open it later, I just don't feel like it now.' Fine. Click other things again. Click click. Try again.   The game is very short too.

Serena is a neat-but-brief point & click thriller featuring a man, his memory-triggering cabin, and snippets of his wife (no pun intended).  Unreliable first-person narration drives the action, as interactions are largely limited to the man's verbal reactions to objects within the cabin. Fortunately, the tedium of this object-response structure is lessened by the setting's dynamism and  abundant easter eggs. Somber music and gradually-dimming lighting create an otherwise immersive atmosphere. The voice acting –while not particularly compelling– brings credibility to Serena's character and accentuates the narrator's development. In the great tradition of the thriller, the plot twists and bends in unexpected ways. I'll let you decide whether it's convincing.  Ultimately, the game is a steal at $0.

I wish I had an option to pick both 'recommend' and 'not recommend' at the same time, really.   I've followed this game from Jan Kavan's profile (a man who is largely responsible for the JULIA:Among the Stars story and music), being curious about this project. I was impressed by 'JULIA' project and I was expecting to see something great here. Sadly, the music is one of the best things about this so-called 'game'. Art is good too, but nothing extremely special about it (combined with a small amount). Texts are good too, but htose text do not have enough fuel to bring enoug fire into that game. Some easter-eggs look out of place, by the way. The last thing I needed there was a Space Quest reference.  The very idea is just great. The 'personal limbo\hell' is an interesting thing to eleborate on, no doubt. But the way it's peresented here - it's too raw and unpolished. I mean...I've experienced 'Silent Hill 2', and 'Serena' is just a pale echo of what the former game had to offer. Non-obvious progression logic might also be unnoying at some point.   Pros - it's free , and it's a nice example of a 'non-typical' game. I guess I'd have been much more angrier had I payed my money for that. Wish they had bigger budget and the game itself were of a bigger scale. It's short.   Cons - it's extremely raw, unpolished and unfinished. It has the idea, but not the ways to express it. No saves.

I am not a fan of the 'Artistic' video game industry, as I feel video games are already a piece of art in their own way, just like any movie, song or painting. So when I saw this game, I was skeptical, as I was fooled once by Proteus.  However, I was not dissapointed this time.  Serena is quite a unique adventure, and although short, I believe it's one of the best stories I've seen in a game before. The fact that the game evolves, that things changes around you while walking around the room gives an impression of madness, and is superbly well done. The atmospheric music is beautiful and draws you further into the characters feelings, while the filter grain, lack of colors and disturbing paintings added to the eerie setting of the game.  There are a few ameliorations that could have been done gameplay wise to create even more immersion, like story branching, a couple of puzzles or maybe just a small inventory system, but maybe this would have caused the game to be less 'artsy' and a bit more of a game, which was not the point.  Overall, it was brilliant, I do recommend it to anyone who would like to try the artistic game genre, as this is a fantastic experience. Definitely worth the look.

This isn't a game in what's become the 'traditional' sense. Point and click is as far as the game mechanics go and I found myself quickly becoming impatient and about to exit the game when the pieces began to fit. Having a very imaginative mind, the story drew me in and creeped the hell out of me the more I played.  This game brings back a lost art in this oversaturated cuture -- that of resourceful storytelling. This game is not for those who lack imagination, lots of patience, and curiosity. Even after connecting the dots and having a good idea where the story was going, the game had me going back and forth looking for clues or things I might have missed. Had mad chills on my spine towards the end.  If this review of Serena has left you at least curious, I absolutely recommend you play this game.  Beautiful graphics. No learning curve. Excellent storytelling. 10/10

Also, the player may (it's a strong 'may') get a bit frustrated with a really 'what do i click?' feeling left after every exposition. But it will be diffrent for everyone.   All in all, go try it. For a short, fun, free game you don't have much to lose. Personally, I LOVE story saturated games where the player 'solves' your way to victory and this game showcases this amazingly.   8/10 --- Go click and have a good time!

HOLY--where do I even begin with this game...This definitely takes things to the level of an 'exprience' more than a simple video game.  Let me start with the superficial aspects: The appearance. This game is beautifully made, I must say. Some say the graphics are 'okay', but personally I find the textures and everything to be absolutely gorgeous, very realistic, if not better than real life..very easy to get the feel of an old, dark, dirty cabin filled with a lifetime of stories and events; it's been truly lived in. As for music and sounds..very clear, for one...while music itself is not a constant thing, it plays out in many important parts, giving serious hints to changes in the plot..very tense, enough to rile you up and wonder what's going to happen next.  For the story...Well, I wont give any spoilers away, because honestly you MUST experience this for yourself to truly understand just how dark and yet beautiful this game is. It took me 70 minutes to complete and it was WORTH IT. This is a story, this is a game, a visual novel..whatever you wish to call it, it is an EXPERIENCE and you are living through the eyes of the protagonist. The voice acting really captures the emotions of the characters...you really feel what they're feeling. For some, it may seem repetitive..to get through the game, you must travel all of the cabin and click each object multiple times to uncover the past about the character and the relationship he had with his wife Serena. For a bit it may seem like you're stuck but as you go through things, you realize that what the protagonist describes slowly changes..he describes more and more..things develop much more deeply and twist and turn in ways you would never expect.  My fiance and I played/watched this game, listening to every detail...we got roped into the emotion of the protagonist, dying to know what happened to Serena, what was going on in this cabin, in this guy's head...and as everything changed from sadness and wonder to..other things..we were in complete shock over and over. The ending is something you will never see coming. You will have many assumptions and if you get invested with the story, you will feel the panic and confusion the story depicts...but the ending...  Even on the forums, people are discussing what the ending could be or mean 100%.... Listen to me, developers of Serena: When someone makes a show/movie, game, book, or anything else, and there are loose ends, or multiple interpretations...when there is a community around a story and people are consistently trying to analyze it and make theories...You KNOW you made something amazing, something that will stay alive for as long as it's talked about. Even when the majority understands the ending, the sheer beauty, darkness, and emotion of this game will be more than enough to rope in other people who have yet to experience it.
I got bored pretty quick playing this one, Serena isint for everyone.

This is a rather good mystery suspense game that puts you into the shoes of a man trying to figure out his life. His wife left him at some point and he tries to find out exactly what happened and why she would leave. It gets to the point where he wonders if all his memories are just figments of a dream. It plays on the psychological aspect of mystery to where there is no actual danger, but your mind can actually start to panic. I actually started to panic along with the character slightly with how intense the story was getting.  It’s a very simple game when you talk in terms of gameplay, just point and click to get into the different items around you or to move around the cabin. Now as you play, you have to click on pretty much everything or else you may not get to the next part of the story, a thing I was trying to figure out and almost didn’t finish the story without looking at a walkthrough. It is real easy to get stuck if you don’t try every little thing and you might have to click on things more then once. There are also audio cues as well you have to listen for as well. So many little things can make the game play a nightmare when stuck.   The textures are very dark and dirty, making it feel slightly like a horror game. There are dark pictures around the cabin that are slightly hard to see but it feels like it’s a very old place. The texture work makes everything very realistic, almost too much texture in some areas, but you can tell something is slightly off. I don’t really get it but its like the lines around everything is a little to crisp and clean to be real.   The voice acting and the music is rather gentle and fits with the whole style of the game. The sad man speaking and narrating his story fits with the sad almost non existent sound. This is really a quiet game. You get music only minimally leaving the haunting impression that makes this game an interesting game to play through.  It is short, sweet and even though sometimes hard to play for a first timer (as sometimes I could not find what would set the next section off) it was a nice short game. It’s free to play on steam right now.
This game Stupido nuff said

Well... What can I say.  Okay. First off. I ended up running straight through the game in about ten minutes. I then later took the time to actually go through and drag it out and get things. I've found that both times the game, while short, offered much in the way of thinking. Granted it was difficult to figure out what to do at times but the main part of the game is 98% clicking around so I can't complain when that is the very purpose although there are hints (When looking at a particular point in the game the character goes 'There's more interesting things, like my books' Which directed me to the bookcase and the next step)  What I can say is that the game is good. It offeres a bit of openendedness to the details of the final end but one of the things I rather enjoy was that with both endings the game changed. The first time when I ended up breezing through it he was sad at the realization of what could have been with Serena and the pain of knowing hope was no longer there. The second time he was full of anger, almost HOW DARE SHE type, as if in denial or attempting to blame what was no longer there on her.  All in all a decent game, one that I think could be expanded on but decent.

The story itself got a little predictable toward the end, and then left me confused with the finale.  Also, the player character's voice gets slightly monotonous.  Would I recommend this for MOST people? No. If you're bored and have an hour to kill, it's an interesting game and there's no doubt some work went into it. Perhaps it just wasn't up my alley.

I 'purchased' Serena not particularly expecting much, since the game was free and the description said 'short'. about 45 minutes later, I came out pleasantly surprised. (inasmuch as 'pleasant' can be used to describe this game) The story unfolds at a decent pace, with only a minor amount of confusion as to the next objective, since the whole game takes place in one room.  The atmosphere does a fair job of building itself, with the ending reveal foreshadowed, yet not wholly easy to spot.  The voice acting, though, is not particularly grabbing, with the protagonist sounding almost bored for some lines, and the other characters making so little appearance that judgement is almost impossible.   If the game were any longer, or cost to play, I wouldn't recommend, but since it's both free and under an hour, It's worth what little of your time it takes up.

First off the good: The graphics for the most part are great, in my opinion. The music, too. The voice acting for the player character is well done, and Serena's is not bad either. Also, while I don't really like the writing or handling of it, the premise of the game has potential, and the first part of the game is actually pretty good.   Now, onto the bad: The writing is what kills the game. The pacing is too slow in the beginning, and too fast in the end (which leaves the characters with very little depth), and the 'twist' you find at the end is something you'll guess as soon as you start exploring. The atmosphere is ruined by things like the silly book titles and the narrator's dialougue going from a melodramatic plea to remember to him casually speaking when you run through dialougue options. And then the ending. I don't want to spoil anything for anyone who's considering playing the game, so let's just say that the graphics and voice acting take a considerable drop in quality, any themes or atmosphere created in the last thirty minutes are ruined, and the last shot is a cliche that will leave you groaning.   I really hate to be so critical to a game that was free, but I was really surprised by it after I read so many positive reviews. Overall, I'd say it's a game that will cost you nothing but your time to play it, so if you're really desperate to kill an hour (or you don't mind a bad story if there's good graphics or sounds), go ahead, but otherwise, I'd just find something else.

Be patient and really take the time to soak all of it in as it makes it all the more satisfying.   Definitely will be thinking about this for a while, great experience.

I saw this game on Steam, (relatively) long ago, just browsing for free games, and figured it was worth a try. It was not until much later that I decided to play it, however, as is the traditition of Steam games. (*shots fired*)  It has come to my attention that I should have played this game much, much sooner.  Serena is a short adventure game created by some veterans of the business. Starting out simply at first, it escalates to an ultimate emotional climax that flaunts an expertly woven cloak of story that gets the most out of the smallest details. A playthrough of it lasts only an hour, but within that hour, the game took me through numerous plot twists, an emotional rollercoaster, and did not cease to peak my curiosity. It got to the point where I even cried a few times. Eveything was just so well done, not to mention original. Add numerous interpretations of the plot to the mix, and you have yourself a masterpiece.  This is one of the best adventure games of all time, as well as now one of my favorite games of all time.  This game is just amazing. If you like deep narratives and/or adventure games, play Serena. Just do it.

This game proved to be more than I originally expected.  It has great development - both in plot and in character.  I am looking forward to replaying this game repeatedly in the future (although I expect that I will not be sleeping well the next few nights.....)
I liked it. Go play it. It's free!

I 'purchased' Serena not particularly expecting much, since the game was free and the description said 'short'. about 45 minutes later, I came out pleasantly surprised. (inasmuch as 'pleasant' can be used to describe this game) The story unfolds at a decent pace, with only a minor amount of confusion as to the next objective, since the whole game takes place in one room.  The atmosphere does a fair job of building itself, with the ending reveal foreshadowed, yet not wholly easy to spot.  The voice acting, though, is not particularly grabbing, with the protagonist sounding almost bored for some lines, and the other characters making so little appearance that judgement is almost impossible.   If the game were any longer, or cost to play, I wouldn't recommend, but since it's both free and under an hour, It's worth what little of your time it takes up.

Serana was a really good little game. When i played it it was free, so i thought why not ? It centres around a man ( Or does it ? ) remembering his wife ( or is it ? ) in a small cottage ( or is he ? ) This is a straight up point and click adventure, with a really good twist, good voice acting, and quite an open-ended story, ripe for interpretation, in my opinion. All for the low, low price of free. Oh, and it took me about 20 mins to download and install. Good game, and kudos especially to the writer of the game ! They managed to fit a lot into such a short game !

Great game. The amazing environment, the suspense and continuous development in the story, along with great voice acting is what helps you keep playing the game. I don't want to spoil anything since it is a short game as you can see in the amount of time I played so I can't really describe very thoroughly enough about what goes on between you and Serena and how the game gets darker throughout the game. Just know every 5 minutes after the initial 'reality pimp-slap' you'll say to yourself, 'WTF?!' and 'woah,...that's deep.' I recommend this to anyone who enjoys suspense with not too much of the horror factor and/or enjoys stories that are dark or filled with desparation. I give this game a 10/10 simply because although it's a short game, it left nothing unexplained and gives you plenty of clues as to what exactly happened to Serena. The atmosphere is what gave this game the feel that the players needed to be immersed into the game with pretty decent graphics. Do yourself a favor and download it now.

Oh my gosh.. This really is a great game! It focuses on the conflict of not remembering a loved one at first and then it.. well, turned into something darker. The atmosphere turned harsher, more morbid as you went on. The ending became very twisted and really does stay with you. I recommend this game to those that like horror, but without the jumpscares. The game isn't really a challenge at all - it's best thought of as an interactive story you progress through, towards an inevitable conclusion. But at telling that story, Serena succeeds admirably, offering some affecting moments along the way - if you can immerse yourself in learning about the character and the situation he's in.  If you're looking for a challenge, or for choices to influence how the story ends, then I'm not going to lie: you'll probably find this is a waste of your time. But, as an interactive and immersive experience of a story, I can highly recommend it. I even basically saw big reveal coming, a way before it actually came, but it didn't lessen the impact. In terms of psychological horror, the game delivers, and I found myself thinking about it some time after I'd finished.

Pleasantly surprised by the depth of this short mystery free title. While the amount of things to interact with is limited and the game is limited to a small cabin, there is a lot of well written monologue and the voice acting is also quite good. Examining the same things multiple times uncover new details of the story, and as you uncover the mystery the main character changes a lot and the story takes a sharp tragic turn. The game also looks and sounds very good for a free title.  The game is short and the gameplay very limited so it may not be for everyone, but as a short experimental title it is highly recommended.
